meanings.definition: A type of flower cluster with stalked flowers growing along a central stem.
meanings.sent1: The raceme of daisies looked beautiful in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The florist arranged the raceme of roses in a tall vase.
meanings.sent3: The raceme of sunflowers waved happily in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a raceme of curls cascading down her back.
meanings.sent5: The raceme of colorful balloons floated above the party.

meanings.definition: A type of inflorescence in which the flowers are arranged on a central axis.
meanings.sent1: The raceme of cherry blossoms bloomed in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the raceme of lilac flowers carefully.
meanings.sent3: The raceme of tulips stood tall like soldiers in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was a raceme of towering buildings.
meanings.sent5: The raceme of streetlights illuminated the dark road.
